column2: Cisco reviewing product code after Juniper software was alteredUPDATE 1-Cisco reviews code after Juniper breach; more scrutiny expected BOSTON
column3: Dec 21 Networking equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc said on Monday it has launched a product review to look for tampering after rival Juniper Networks Inc's  disclosure it found code in firewall software that made in vulnerable to cyber attacks.  UPDATE 1-Cisco reviews code after Juniper breach; more scrutiny expected BOSTON
column4: Dec 21 Networking equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc said on Monday it has launched a product review to look for tampering after rival Juniper Networks Inc's  disclosure it found code in firewall software that made in vulnerable to cyber attacks. BOSTON
column5: Dec 21 Cisco Systems Inc said on Monday that it is reviewing its product code for "malicious modification" in the wake of rival Juniper Networks Inc's  disclosure last week that it had found unauthorized code in its firewall software.UPDATE 1-Cisco reviews code after Juniper breach; more scrutiny expected BOSTON
column6: Dec 21 Networking equipment maker Cisco Systems Inc said on Monday it has launched a product review to look for tampering after rival Juniper Networks Inc's  disclosure it found code in firewall software that made in vulnerable to cyber attacks.

column2: UPDATE 1-Panasonic buys U.S. refrigeration firm Hussmann for $1.5 bln TOKYO
column3: Dec 21 Japanese electronics maker Panasonic Corp is set to buy U.S. refrigeration firm Hussmann for over 186.6 billion yen ($1.5 billion) in a deal it says will leverage its technology and help it break into the U.S. food distribution industry.

column2: Lockheed meets goal of delivering 45 F-35 jets in 2015 - PentagonLockheed wins $1.17 bln deal for early work on more F-35 jetsLockheed wins $1.17 billion deal for early work on more F-35 jetsUPDATE 3-Lockheed meets goal of delivering 45 F-35 jets in 2015 -Pentagon WASHINGTON
column3: Dec 21 Lockheed Martin Corp  met its goal of delivering 45 F-35 fighter jets to the U.S. government and key allies in 2015

column2: Shari Redstone refused to sell stake in media empire - WSJUPDATE 2-Shari Redstone refused to sell stake in media empire - WSJ Dec 21 Shari Redstone refused an offer from her media mogul father Sumner to sell her 20 percent stake in the holding company that controls Viacom Inc and CBS Corp  for $1 billion
